I think we did a pretty good job so far.

A pretty fun game to play, especially with your freinds. However it is slightly competetive even between the survivors and can frustrating for you or your friends when one of you decide to save themself instead of going for a slight chance of saving the other.
The game also suffers occationally from balance issues and tried and true strageties that seem fairly OP. It is quite alot in the hands of the killer to make it a fun game, even if he needs to sacrifice some of his succes for it. Obviosly some killers will not make that sacrefice and will do everything to kill you (what the game acctually is supposed to be like) but this ruins the game for the survivors in many cases.

The verdict would be 6/10, worth between 10-20â‚¬ so I would definetly recommend buying it on sale!

Skill based matchmaking and the never ending and continuous nerfs of killers has ruined this game.  If things keep up this way, the game is going to die.  I have very little will to continue playing this game any longer.

I may not have enough hours on the game to give an insightful, proper review but I love the game. Despite the toxic community and seemingly uncaring devs, it is a fun game and the 1.5 update doesn't change much. Sure it screws many over with the buffs to the killers but I make do just fine. I am a huge fan and will continue to be, it has it's flaws of course. The SWF option is still very broken and refuses to work, I hope they get to that soon as they claim to. Aside from the occasional laggy killer, the broken SWF, and toxic community, the game is loads of fun, has interesting lore, and the DLC is also very cool.

I got a couple of hours in this game, and I must say the game was fun.

With the new update, the killer got a massive buff to chasing down their pray, which makes it harder for survivors to actually escape the killer, pallet looping is not a stategy thats efficient anymore.

If you get certain maps with minimal pallets you are basicly doomed to die unless you get a bad killer or just have really good survivors on your team.

If you are trying out as a fresh survivor you are going to die alot, because of the mechanics that is now, it's not bambi friendly at all. But once you get some decent perks your survival might get better and better.

I have played for 800+ hrs but when they ruined the game with the 27-apr-2017 patch i uninstalled it, The dev team are not impartial, they are killer favor, so i stop waste my time on this game.  I hope some other company will develop the game concept best. The game are ALWAYS (95% time) lagging and they remove the possibility of see killer in lobby, then now it's not possible to dodge lagger killers. Most killers set the Steam download region very far from the real region so survivors can't run and can't play as normal. The dev team always ignore reported players; it's possible to report but it does not serve anything. This is not a rant, this is a review after 800+ hours spent. How it's possible create a multiplayer game without servers in 2017?

After leaving a negative review and simply walking away from this game quite some time ago I decided to give it a second shot. I figured surely things should be much better after all this time and to an extent it is. A couple of maps seem to favor the killer heavily but the rest seem fairly balanced. Each side has their own powerful perks that give a bit of an edge in different ways. there is a lot more variety than there were which is nice to keep tihngs interesting. The community doesnt appear to be as toxic but toxicity is still there. (like you'll ever completely get rid of it all) People still leave but no where near as much if at all. Still Peer to Peer (lame) but whatever conections are far mor stable. I haven't had a game yet where i was DC'd mid match but i have had a few lobby join attempts fail. (pause your porn you fools) Matchmaking also seems to have improved greatly. Most games have been pretty balanced with only a few being either total wipes or easy escapes. Microtransactions (eh) but only for cosmetics which is fine. Love the new shard system that lets you learn teachable perks without having to grind a character for it. Wish it was easier to get shards though cause it feels like your total level progresses a little slow. People are more altruistic than before and killers are far less campy. I still have no idea what some of the 'status effects' mean but when i stop being lazy I'll probably google them. Maybe some explanation can be added to the corresponding perks. Case in point broken and exposed. I had no idea that broken meant you're always one hit and that exposed make you one hit so when taking those perks kinda messed me up. Matchmaking is faster than before but I'm sure thats because of a larger player base now than from before. Survivors time are pretty faster generally under a min to find a game where killer you're looking at about a min or 2. I find myself enjoying both survivor and killer but with more time as survivor due to my point investments.

tl;dr better than before give it a shot

The hitboxes are now even worse than ever, every game I have been in has been filled with questionable hits which I thought was my connection at first but after seeing everyone on the reddit complaining about the hitboxes I have determined thats not the case.

Lastly, the new animations are way too stiff and rigid, the characters that were very fluid and charismatic (almost cartoonish) are now a lot more serious and honestly, its kind of uncanny the way they move. Its honestly freakier than some of the killers.

Unfortunately BHVR havent listened one bit to the community feedback from the PTR and I can only hope they revert these changes or implement some kind of fix ASAP.

This is a very solid game. I used to play it when it came out and I stopped after awhile because it kept bugging out and caused me to have to restart over and over and trying to play with friends was horrid. I recently came back and all of those problems are fixed. I can't play anything other than this because I'm so addicted to it now. The dlc's are worth it if you like to play killer, and dope survivor outfits. My only advice is to remember the point of the game and don't get upset because a killer decides to actually kill you rather than play around and point farm with you.


ALSO, some people complain about wait times in this game. If you play killer it's not a huge issue, however I'm a survivor. Just for a quick tip I play on US - Dallas during the day, and then at about 12:30-1:00 a.m. I'll switch my steam download settings to Canada - Toronto and get insta queues almost always. They have a lot of killers. Happy hunting! (Or escaping)
